terms.definition: A claim or status of possessing property or rights that is not legally recognized, enforceable, or established according to law.
The individual or entity who possesses legal title and recognized rights to a property or asset, as established by law.
A government office responsible for officially registering various legal documents, particularly those related to property transactions, to make them publicly recorded and legally valid.
Occupying or having control over a property or asset without the legal right, permission, or title to do so.
Assertions or declarations made by an individual or entity stating they have a legal right or title to a specific property or asset.
Government departments or officials legally authorized to manage land records, collect taxes, and regulate urban development within their jurisdiction.
A legal phrase used to introduce a shorter, consistent name or term that will be used to refer to a person, entity, or concept throughout the rest of a document.
A legally valid and properly executed document that formally records the transfer of property ownership from a seller to a buyer.
A legal document that officially transfers ownership or rights to property, which has been formally recorded with the appropriate government registration authority.
Any legal paper used to officially move the ownership or rights of an asset, property, or title from one person or entity to another.
A transaction or process of moving ownership or rights that is legally sound, properly executed, and recognized by law.
